title: Looking for a slab...
content:
Can someone make suggestions? I’m wondering if a face exists that is similar to a condensed Cheltenham, with the heavy slab quality of clarendon.  
 [Consort](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164021/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/searchresults.htm?st=10&part=RR-1198&pn=Consort%20Bold%20Condensed) is a good one, but I’d like to hear some other alternatives.

 [‹ Zapfino prose?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164021/http:/typophile.com/node/18286 "Go to previous forum topic") [Small Cap Suggestions? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164021/http:/typophile.com/node/18292 "Go to next forum topic")
author: koleslaw

comments.content: Hmm. I wonder if you’d like [Giza](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164021/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Giza) designed by David Berlow for Font Bureau?

Perhaps Farao from Stormtype?  
 [http://www.stormtype.com/farao.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164021/http:/www.stormtype.com/farao.html "http://www.stormtype.com/farao.html")

It’s not condensed though...

Pieter  
PS Giza is also very nice

Depending on how importatnt the condenced thing is, you might consider OXTAIL?

[http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164021/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")
